end_time.comment: The most recent time present in this result set in Unix epoch time; this should be used as the next start_time

next_page.comment: The URL that should be called to get the next set of results

count.comment: The number of results returned for the current request

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the user is created

email.comment: The user's primary email address. *Writeable on create only. On update, a secondary email is added. See Email Address

active.comment: false if the user has been deleted

alias.comment: An alias displayed to end users

chat_only.comment: Whether or not the user is a chat-only agent

created_at.comment: The time the user was created

custom_role_id.comment: A custom role if the user is an agent on the Enterprise plan

role_type.comment: The user's role id. 0 for custom agents, 1 for light agent and 2 for chat agent

details.comment: Any details you want to store about the user, such as an address

external_id.comment: A unique identifier from another system. The API treats the id as case insensitive. Example: ian1 and Ian1 are the same user

last_login_at.comment: The last time the user signed in to Zendesk Support

moderator.comment: Designates whether the user has forum moderation capabilities

notes.comment: Any notes you want to store about the user

only_private_comments.comment: true if the user can only create private comments

organization_id.comment: The id of the organization the user is associated with

default_group_id.comment: The id of the user's default group. *Can only be set on create, not on update

phone.comment: The user's primary phone number. See Phone Number below

shared_phone_number.comment: Whether the phone number is shared or not. See Phone Number below

photo.comment: The user's profile picture represented as an Attachment object

restricted_agent.comment: If the agent has any restrictions; false for admins and unrestricted agents, true for other agents

role.comment: The user's role. Possible values are "end-user", "agent", or "admin"

shared.comment: If the user is shared from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

shared_agent.comment: If the user is a shared agent from a different Zendesk Support instance. Ticket sharing accounts only

signature.comment: The user's signature. Only agents and admins can have signatures

suspended.comment: If the agent is suspended. Tickets from suspended users are also suspended, and these users cannot sign in to the end user portal

tags.comment: The user's tags. Only present if your account has user tagging enabled

ticket_restriction.comment: Specifies which tickets the user has access to. Possible values are: "organization", "groups", "assigned", "requested", null

time_zone.comment: The user's time zone. See Time Zone

two_factor_auth_enabled.comment: If two factor authentication is enabled.

updated_at.comment: The time the user was last updated

url.comment: The user's API url

user_fields.comment: Values of custom fields in the user's profile. See User Fields

verified.comment: The user's primary identity is verified or not. For secondary identities, see User Identities

report_csv.comment: Whether or not the user can access the CSV report on the Search tab of the Reporting page in the Support admin interface. See Analyzing Help Center search results in Help Center. Only available on the Guide Professional plan

url.comment: The API url of this identity

value.comment: The identifier for this identity, such as an email address

verified.comment: If the identity has been verified

primary.comment: If the identity is the primary identity. *Writable only when creating, not when updating. Use the Make Identify Primary endpoint instead

created_at.comment: The time the identity was created

updated_at.comment: The time the identity was updated

undeliverable_count.comment: The number of times a soft-bounce response was received at that address

email.comment: The primary email address of this user

created_at.comment: The time the user was created

locale_id.comment: The language identifier for this user

organization_id.comment: The id of the organization this user is associated with

phone.comment: The primary phone number of this user. See Phone Number in the Users API

shared_phone_number.comment: Whether the phone number is shared or not. See Phone Number in the Users API

photo.comment: The user's profile picture represented as an Attachment object

role.comment: The role of the user. Possible values: "end-user", "agent", "admin"

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the user

url.comment: The API url of this user

verified.comment: The user's primary identity is verified or not. For secondary identities, see User Identities

url.comment: The API url of this group

deleted.comment: Deleted groups get marked as such

created_at.comment: The time the group was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the group

url.comment: The API url of this record

default.comment: If true, tickets assigned directly to the agent will assume this membership's group.

created_at.comment: The time the membership was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the membership

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the organization is created

url.comment: The API url of this organization

external_id.comment: A unique external id to associate organizations to an external record

name.comment: A unique name for the organization

created_at.comment: The time the organization was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the organization

domain_names.comment: An array of domain names associated with this organization

details.comment: Any details obout the organization, such as the address

notes.comment: Any notes you have about the organization

group_id.comment: New tickets from users in this organization are automatically put in this group

shared_tickets.comment: End users in this organization are able to see each other's tickets

shared_comments.comment: End users in this organization are able to see each other's comments on tickets

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the membership is created

url.comment: The API url of this membership

user_id.comment: The ID of the user for whom this memberships belongs

organization_id.comment: The ID of the organization associated with this user, in this membership

default.comment: Denotes whether this is the default organization membership for the user. If false, returns null

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

url.comment: The API url of this request

subject.comment: The value of the subject field for this request if the subject field is visible to end users; a truncated version of the description otherwise

description.comment: The first comment on the request

custom_fields.comment: The fields and entries for this request

assignee_id.comment: The id of the assignee if the field is visible to end users

group_id.comment: The id of the assigned group if the field is visible to end users

collaborator_ids.comment: Who are currently CC'ed on the ticket

via.comment: This object explains how the request was created

is_public.comment: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

due_at.comment: When the task is due (only applies if the request is of type "task")

can_be_solved_by_me.comment: If true, end user can mark request as solved.

solved.comment: Whether or not request is solved (an end user can set this if "can_be_solved_by_me", above, is true for that user)

ticket_form_id.comment: The numeric id of the ticket form associated with this request if the form is visible to end users - only applicable for enterprise accounts

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

recipient.comment: The original recipient e-mail address of the request

followup_source_id.comment: The id of the original ticket if this request is a follow-up ticket

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the ticket is created

url.comment: The API url of this ticket

external_id.comment: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

type.comment: The type of this ticket. Possible values: "problem", "incident", "question" or "task"

subject.comment: The value of the subject field for this ticket

raw_subject.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "subject" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: The first comment on the ticket

priority.comment: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed. Possible values: "urgent", "high", "normal", "low"

status.comment: The state of the ticket. Possible values: "new", "open", "pending", "hold", "solved", "closed"

recipient.comment: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

requester_id.comment: The user who requested this ticket

submitter_id.comment: The user who submitted the ticket. The submitter always becomes the author of the first comment on the ticket

assignee_id.comment: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

organization_id.comment: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships

group_id.comment: The group this ticket is assigned to

collaborator_ids.comment: The ids of users currently cc'ed on the ticket

collaborators.comment: POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See Setting Collaborators

forum_topic_id.comment: The topic this ticket originated from, if any

problem_id.comment: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

has_incidents.comment: Is true of this ticket has been marked as a problem, false otherwise

due_at.comment: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.

tags.comment: The array of tags applied to this ticket

via.comment: This object explains how the ticket was created

custom_fields.comment: Custom fields for the ticket. See Setting custom field values

satisfaction_rating.comment: The satisfaction rating of the ticket, if it exists, or the state of satisfaction, 'offered' or 'unoffered'

sharing_agreement_ids.comment: The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket

followup_ids.comment: The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed

via_followup_source_id.comment: POST requests only. The id of a closed ticket when creating a follow-up ticket. See Creating Follow-up Tickets

macro_ids.comment: POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit

ticket_form_id.comment: Enterprise only. The id of the ticket form to render for the ticket

brand_id.comment: Enterprise only. The id of the brand this ticket is associated with

allow_channelback.comment: Is false if channelback is disabled, true otherwise. Only applicable for channels framework ticket

allow_attachments.comment: When an agent responds, are they allowed to add attachments?  Defaults to true

is_public.comment: Is true if any comments are public, false otherwise

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

file_name.comment: The name of the image file

content_url.comment: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded

content_type.comment: The content type of the image. Example value: image/png

size.comment: The size of the image file in bytes

thumbnails.comment: An array of Photo objects. Note that thumbnails do not have thumbnails.

inline.comment: If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

url.comment: The API url of this rating

assignee_id.comment: The id of agent assigned to at the time of rating

group_id.comment: The id of group assigned to at the time of rating

requester_id.comment: The id of ticket requester submitting the rating

ticket_id.comment: The id of ticket being rated

created_at.comment: The time the satisfaction rating got created

updated_at.comment: The time the satisfaction rating got updated

comment.comment: The comment received with this rating, if available

reason.comment: The reason for a bad rating given by the requester in a follow-up question. Satisfaction reasons must be enabled

reason_code.comment: The default reasons the user can select from a list menu for giving a negative rating. See Reason codes in the Satisfaction Reasons API. Can only be set on ratings with a score of "bad".

url.comment: API URL for the resource

reason_code.comment: An account-level code for referencing the reason. Custom reasons are assigned an auto-incrementing integer (non-system reason codes begin at 1000). See Reason codes

value.comment: Translated value of the reason in the account locale.

raw_value.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the current "value", if not. See Dynamic Content

created_at.comment: The time the reason was created

updated_at.comment: The time the reason was updated

deleted_at.comment: The time the reason was deleted

url.comment: The API url of this ticket

author.comment: The author id (if available), name and email

subject.comment: The value of the subject field for this ticket

message_id.comment: The ID of the email, if available

ticket_id.comment: The ticket ID this suspended email is associated with, if available

recipient.comment: The original recipient e-mail address of the ticket

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

via.comment: This object explains how the ticket was created

brand_id.comment: The id of the brand this ticket is associated with - only applicable for enterprise accounts

ticket_id.comment: The ID of the associated ticket

metadata.comment: Metadata for the audit, custom and system data

via.comment: This object explains how this audit was created

created_at.comment: The time the audit was created

author_id.comment: The user who created the audit

events.comment: An array of the events that happened in this audit. See Audit Events

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

type.comment: Comment or VoiceComment. The JSON object for voice comments is different. See voice comment event for the format

public.comment: true if a public comment; false if an internal note. The initial value set on ticket creation persists for any additional comment unless you change it

author_id.comment: The id of the comment author. See Author id

via.comment: How the comment was created. See Via Object

metadata.comment: System information (web client, IP address, etc.) and comment flags, if any. See Comment flags

created_at.comment: The time the comment was created
Time the skip was created

updated_at.comment: Time the skip was last updated

url.comment: The API url of this ticket metric

group_stations.comment: Number of groups this ticket passed through

assignee_stations.comment: Number of assignees this ticket had

reopens.comment: Total number of times the ticket was reopened

replies.comment: Total number of times ticket was replied to

assignee_updated_at.comment: When the assignee last updated the ticket

requester_updated_at.comment: When the requester last updated the ticket

status_updated_at.comment: When the status was last updated

initially_assigned_at.comment: When the ticket was initially assigned

assigned_at.comment: When the ticket was last assigned

latest_comment_added_at.comment: When the latest comment was added

first_resolution_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the first resolution time inside and out of business hours

reply_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the first reply inside and out of business hours

full_resolution_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes to the full resolution inside and out of business hours

agent_wait_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes the agent spent waiting inside and out of business hours

requester_wait_time_in_minutes.comment: Number of minutes the requester spent waiting inside and out of business hours

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the record is created

metric.comment: One of the following: agent_work_time, pausable_update_time, periodic_update_time, reply_time, requester_wait_time, or resolution_time

instance_id.comment: The instance of the metric associated with the event. See instance_id

type.comment: One of the following: activate, pause, fulfill, apply_sla, breach, or update_status. See Metric event types

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the session is created

url.comment: The API URL of this session

last_seen_at.comment: The last approximate time this session was seen. This does not update on every request.

restriction.comment: Who may access this account. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it.

execution.comment: An object describing how the view should be executed

conditions.comment: An object describing how the view is constructed

watchable.comment: Whether or not view can be watched for incremental changes on it

created_at.comment: The time the view was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the view

position.comment: Position of the trigger, determines the order they will execute in

conditions.comment: An object that describes the conditions under which the trigger will execute

actions.comment: An array of Actions describing what the trigger will do

created_at.comment: The time the trigger was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the trigger

position.comment: Position of the automation, determines the order they will execute in

conditions.comment: An object that describes the conditions under which the automation will execute

actions.comment: An object describing what the automation will do

created_at.comment: The time the automation was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the automation

title.comment: The title of the SLA policy

description.comment: The description of the SLA policy

position.comment: Position of the SLA policy, determines the order they will be matched. If not specified, SLA Policy is added as the last position

filter.comment: An object that describes the conditions that a ticket must match in order for an SLA policy to be applied to that ticket

created_at.comment: The time the SLA policy was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the SLA policy

type.comment: A pre-defined target, such as "basecamp_target". See the additional attributes for the type that follow

active.comment: Whether or not the target is activated

created_at.comment: The time the target was created

id.comment: The ID of the target failure

url.comment: The API url of the failure record

status_code.comment: HTTP status code of the target failure

message.comment: The message returned with the status code

created_at.comment: Time of the failure

consecutive_failure_count.comment: Number of times the target failed

raw_request.comment: The raw message of the target request

raw_response.comment: The raw response of the failure

actions.comment: An object describing what the macro will do

active.comment: Useful for determining if the macro should be displayed

restriction.comment: Who may access this macro. Will be null when everyone in the account can access it

created_at.comment: The time the macro was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the macro

actor_id.comment: id of the user creating the ticket

source_id.comment: id of the item being audited

source_type.comment: type of the item being audited

source_label.comment: name of the item being audited

changes_description.comment: description of the change that occurred

ip_address.comment: ip of the user doing the audit

created_at.comment: The time the audit got created

url.comment: The API url of this brand

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the brand is created

has_help_center.comment: If the brand has a Help Center

help_center_state.comment: The state of the Help Center: enabled, disabled, or restricted

active.comment: If the brand is set as active

default.comment: Is the brand the default brand for this account

ticket_form_ids.comment: The ids of ticket forms that are available for use by a brand

created_at.comment: The time the brand was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the brand

host_mapping.comment: The hostmapping to this brand, if any (only admins view this key)

signature_template.comment: The signature template for a brand

url.comment: The API url of this item

name.comment: The unique name of the item

placeholder.comment: Automatically generated placeholder for the item, derived from name

default_locale_id.comment: The default locale for the item. Must be one of the locales the account has active.

outdated.comment: Indicates the item has outdated variants within it

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

id.description: Either the ID or the bcp-47 code of the locale (es-419, en-us, pr-br)

bidi_chars.description: Wrap translations with unicode directional characters indicating a rendering direction according to the locale

fallback.description: This will prevent a fallback value for translations from being provided. The default value is true. When it is set to false, translations missing a value will be returned as an empty string.

include.description: This is the standard Zendesk side-load query parameter. The only option accepted here is translations

packages.description: This allows you to specify a package, or list of packages (comma separated), to scope the response to when translations are side-loaded.

raw.description: This will prevent HTML from being sanitized when translations are side-loaded. The default value is false.

url.comment: The URL for this resource

key.comment: A unique key that identifies this custom field. This is used for updating the field and referencing in placeholders.

type.comment: Type of the custom field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "dropdown", "integer", "regexp", "text", or "textarea"

title.comment: The title of the custom field

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: User-defined description of this field's purpose

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

position.comment: Ordering of the field relative to other fields

active.comment: If true, this field is available for use

system.comment: If true, only active and position values of this field can be changed

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the ticket field

tag.comment: Optional for custom field of type "checkbox"; not presented otherwise.

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown"

intervals.comment: Array of intervals for the schedule

created_at.comment: Time the schedule was created

updated_at.comment: Time the schedule was last updated

type.comment: Can be one of the following: 'inbound', 'outbound'

status.comment: Can be one of the following: 'accepted', 'declined', 'pending', 'inactive'

partner_name.comment: Can be one of the following: 'jira', null

remote_subdomain.comment: Subdomain of the remote account or null if not associated with an account

created_at.comment: The time the record was created

default.comment: Whether the address is the account's default support address

created_at.comment: When the address was created

updated_at.comment: When the address was updated

raw_name.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

display_name.comment: The name of the form that is displayed to an end user

raw_display_name.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "display_name" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

position.comment: The position of this form among other forms in the account, i.e. dropdown

active.comment: If the form is set as active

end_user_visible.comment: Is the form visible to the end user

default.comment: Is the form the default form for this account

ticket_field_ids.comment: ids of all ticket fields which are in this ticket form

in_all_brands.comment: Is the form available for use in all brands on this account

restricted_brand_ids.comment: ids of all brands that this ticket form is restricted to

url.comment: The URL for this resource

type.comment: The type of the ticket field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "integer", "regexp", "tagger", "text", or "textarea". *Type is not editable once created.

title.comment: The title of the ticket field

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: The description of the purpose of this ticket field, shown to users

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

position.comment: A relative position for the ticket fields that determines the order of ticket fields on a ticket. Note that positions 0 to 7 are reserved for system fields

required.comment: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by agents

collapsed_for_agents.comment: If this field should be shown to agents by default or be hidden alongside infrequently used fields. Classic interface only

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

title_in_portal.comment: The title of the ticket field when shown to end users

raw_title_in_portal.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title_in_portal" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

visible_in_portal.comment: Whether this field is available to end users

editable_in_portal.comment: Whether this field is editable by end users

required_in_portal.comment: If it's required for this field to have a value when updated by end users

tag.comment: A tag value to set for checkbox fields when checked

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the ticket field

system_field_options.comment: Presented for a ticket field of type "tickettype", "priority" or "status"

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a ticket field of type "tagger"

sub_type_id.comment: "priority" and "status" fields only, inaccessible to all other field types. Defaults to 0. A "priority" sub type of 1 removes the "Low" and "Urgent" options. A "status" sub type of 1 adds the "On-Hold" option.

removable.comment: If this field is not a system basic field that must be present for all tickets on the account

agent_description.comment: A description of the ticket field that only agents can see

url.comment: The URL for this resource

key.comment: A unique key that identifies this custom field. This is used for updating the field and referencing in placeholders.

type.comment: Type of the custom field: "checkbox", "date", "decimal", "dropdown", "integer", "regexp", "text", or "textarea"

title.comment: The title of the custom field

raw_title.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "title" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

description.comment: User-defined description of this field's purpose

raw_description.comment: The dynamic content placeholder, if present, or the "description" value, if not. See Dynamic Content

position.comment: Ordering of the field relative to other fields

active.comment: If true, this field is available for use

system.comment: If true, only active and position values of this field can be changed

regexp_for_validation.comment: Regular expression field only. The validation pattern for a field value to be deemed valid.

created_at.comment: The time the ticket field was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the ticket field

tag.comment: Optional for custom field of type "checkbox"; not presented otherwise.

custom_field_options.comment: Required and presented for a custom field of type "dropdown"

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the job is queued

url.comment: The URL to poll for status updates

total.comment: The total number of tasks this job is batching through

progress.comment: Number of tasks that have already been completed

status.comment: The current status. One of the following: "queued", "working", "failed", "completed", "killed"

message.comment: Message from the job worker, if any

page_background_color.comment: HEX of the page background color

text_color.comment: HEX of the text color, usually matched to contrast well with header_color

header_logo_url.comment: The URL for the custom header logo

favicon_url.comment: The URL for the custom favicon

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the job is queued

url.comment: The URL to poll for status updates

app_id.comment: The ID of the app created by this job, if it exists

total.comment: The total number of tasks this job is batching through

message.comment: Message from the job worker, if any

retry_in.comment: Number of seconds after which you may re-check status

installations.comment: An array of app installation ids

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record was last updated

orderable.comment: True if reordering has any effect

collapsible.comment: True if collapsing has any effect

identifier.comment: The unique identifier for this client

secret.comment: The client secret. Generated automatically on creation and returned in full only at that time.

company.comment: Choose a company name to display when users are asked to approve access to your application. The name will help users understand who they are granting access to.

description.comment: A short description of your client that is displayed to users when they are considering approving access to your application.

redirect_uri.comment: An array of the valid redirect URIs for this client

user_id.comment: The id of the admin who created the client

global.comment: Whether this client is globally accessible. Learn more

url.comment: The API url of this record

logo_url.comment: The API logo url of this record

created_at.comment: The time the client was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the client

user_id.comment: The id of the user this token authenticates as

client_id.comment: The id of the client this token belongs to

scopes.comment: An array of the valid scopes for this token. See Scopes below

url.comment: The API url of this record

created_at.comment: The time the token was created

expires_at.comment: The time the token will expire

used_at.comment: The latest time this token was used for authentication

scope.comment: The valid scopes for this token. See Scope below

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the client is created

identifier.comment: The unique identifier for the client

company.comment: The company that users are asked to approve access to.

description.comment: A short description of the client

logo_url.comment: The API logo url of this record

url.comment: The API url of this activity

verb.comment: The type of activity. Can be tickets.assignment, tickets.comment, or  tickets.priority_increase

user.comment: The user this activity pertains to

actor.comment: The actor causing the creation of the activity

created_at.comment: When this record was created

updated_at.comment: When this record last got updated

object.comment: The content of this activity. Can be a ticket, comment, or change.

target.comment: The target of this activity, a ticket.

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the bookmark is created

url.comment: The API url of this bookmark

ticket.comment: An object containing the properties of the bookmarked ticket

created_at.comment: The time the bookmark was created
The time the identity got created

updated_at.comment: The time the identity got updated

instance_push_id.comments: The ID of the account to which data will be pushed. This was passed to the integration service when the administrator set up the account

request_id.comments: A unique identifier for the push request

created_at.comment: The time the handle was created

updated_at.comment: The time of the last update of the handle

avatar_url.comment: The profile image url of the handle

name.comment: The profile name of the handle

allow_reply.comment: If replies are allowed for this handle

can_reply.comment: If replies are allowed for this handle

brand_id.comment: What brand the handle is associated with

locale.comment: The locale that the category is displayed in

source_locale.comment: The source (default) locale of the category

url.comment: The API url of this category

html_url.comment: The url of this category in Help Center

outdated.comment: Whether the category is out of date

position.comment: The position of this category relative to other categories

created_at.comment: The time at which the category was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the category was last updated

locale.comment: The locale in which the section is displayed

source_locale.comment: The source (default) locale of the section

url.comment: The API url of this section

html_url.comment: The url of this section in HC

category_id.comment: The id of the category to which this section belongs

outdated.comment: Whether the section is out of date

position.comment: The position of this section in the section list. By default the section is added to the end of the list

manageable_by.comment: The set of users who can manage this section

user_segment_id.comment: The id of the user segment to which this section belongs

created_at.comment: The time at which the section was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the section was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the article is created

url.comment: The API url of the article

html_url.comment: The url of the article in Help Center

locale.comment: The locale that the article is being displayed in

source_locale.comment: The source (default) locale of the article

author_id.comment: The id of the user who wrote the article (set to the user who made the request on create by default)

comments_disabled.comment: True if comments are disabled; false otherwise

outdated_locales.comment: Locales in which the article was marked as outdated

outdated.comment: Deprecated. Always false because the source translation is always the most up-to-date translation

label_names.comment: An array of label names associated with this article. By default no label names are used. Only available on certain plans

draft.comment: True if the translation for the current locale is a draft; false otherwise. false by default. Can be set when creating but not when updating. For updating, see Translations

promoted.comment: True if this article is promoted; false otherwise. false by default

position.comment: The position of this article in the article list. 0 by default

vote_sum.comment: The sum of upvotes (+1) and downvotes (-1), which may be positive or negative

vote_count.comment: The total number of upvotes and downvotes

section_id.comment: The id of the section to which this article belongs

created_at.comment: The time the article was created

edited_at.comment: The time the article was last edited in its displayed locale

updated_at.comment: The time the article was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

url.comment: The API url of this comment

body.comment: The comment made by the author

author_id.comment: The id of the author of this comment. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Comment

source_id.comment: The id of the item on which this comment was made

source_type.comment: The type of the item on which this comment was made. Currently only supports 'Article'

locale.comment: The locale in which this comment was made

html_url.comment: The url at which the comment is presented in Help Center

created_at.comment: The time at which the comment was created. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Comment

updated_at.comment: The time at which the comment was last updated

vote_sum.comment: The sum of upvotes (+1) and downvotes (-1), which may be positive or negative

vote_count.comment: The total number of upvotes and downvotes

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the label is created

url.comment: The API url of this label

name.comment: The actual name of the label

created_at.comment: The time at which the label was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the label was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the article attachment is created

url.comment: The API url of this article attachment

article_id.comment: Id of the associated article, if present

content_url.comment: A full URL where the attachment file can be downloaded

content_type.comment: The content type of the file. Example: image/png

size.comment: The size of the attachment file in bytes

inline.comment: If true, the attached file is shown in the dedicated admin UI for inline attachments and its url can be referenced in the HTML body of the article. If false, the attachment is listed in the list of attachments. Default is false

created_at.comment: The time at which the article attachment was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the article attachment was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when a translation is created

url.comment: The API url of the translation

html_url.comment: The url of the translation in Help Center

source_id.comment: The id of the item that has this translation

source_type.comment: The type of the item that has this translation. Can be Article, Section, or Category

body.comment: The body of the translation. Empty by default

outdated.comment: True if the translation is outdated; false otherwise. False by default

draft.comment: True if the translation is a draft; false otherwise. False by default

created_at.comment: The time at which the translation was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the translation was last updated

updated_by_id.comment: The id of the user who last updated the translation

created_by_id.comment: The id of the user who created the translation

snippet.comment: The portion of an article that is relevant to the search query, with matching words or phrases delimited by tags. Example: a query for "carrot potato" might return the snippet "...don't confuse carrots with potatoes..."

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the topic is created

url.comment: The API url of the topic

html_url.comment: The community url of the topic

description.comment: The description of the topic. By default an empty string

position.comment: The position of the topic relative to other topics in the community

follower_count.comment: The number of users following the topic

manageable_by.comment: The set of users who can manage this topic

user_segment_id.comment: The id of the user segment to which this topic belongs

created_at.comment: When the topic was created

updated_at.comment: When the topic was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the post is created

url.comment: The API url of the post

html_url.comment: The community url of the post

author_id.comment: The id of the author of the post. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Post

pinned.comment: When true, pins the post to the top of its topic

status.comment: The status of the post. Possible values: "planned", "not_planned" , "answered", or "completed"

vote_sum.comment: The sum of upvotes (+1) and downvotes (-1), which may be positive or negative

vote_count.comment: The total number of upvotes and downvotes

comment_count.comment: The number of comments on the post

follower_count.comment: The number of followers of the post

topic_id.comment: The id of the topic that the post belongs to

created_at.comment: When the post was created. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Post

updated_at.comment: When the post was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

url.comment: The API url of the comment

html_url.comment: The community url of the comment

body.comment: The comment made by the author

author_id.comment: The id of the author of the comment. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Comment

post_id.comment: The id of the post on which the comment was made

official.comment: Whether the comment is marked as official

vote_sum.comment: The sum of upvotes (+1) and downvotes (-1), which may be positive or negative

vote_count.comment: The total number of upvotes and downvotes

created_at.comment: When the comment was created. *Writable on create by Help Center managers -- see Create Comment

updated_at.comment: When the comment was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the subscription is created

url.comment: The API url of the subscription

user_id.comment: The id of the user who has this subscription

content_id.comment: The id of the subscribed item

content_type.comment: The type of the subscribed item

locale.comment: The locale of the subscribed item

include_comments.comment: Subscribe also to article comments. Only for section subscriptions.

created_at.comment: The time at which the subscription was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the subscription was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the vote is created

url.comment: The API url of this vote

user_id.comment: The id of the user who cast this vote

item_id.comment: The id of the item for which this vote was cast

item_type.comment: The type of the item. Can be "Article", "Post" or "PostComment"

created_at.comment: The time at which the vote was created

updated_at.comment: The time at which the vote was last updated

id.comment: Automatically assigned when the user segment is created

name.comment: User segment name (localized to the locale of the current user for built-in user segments)

user_type.comment: The set of users who can view content

group_ids.comment: The ids of the groups that have access

organization_ids.comment: The ids of the organizations that have access

tags.comment: The tags a user must have to have access

created_at.comment: When the user segment was created

updated_at.comment: When the user segment was last updated

built_in.comment: Whether the user segment is built-in. Built-in user segments cannot be modified

account_key.description: The widget key for the account

create_date.description: The date of creation of the account

plan.description: Information about the package of the account

billing.description: The billing information of the account

display_name.description: The name to be displayed for the agent

create_date.description: The date of creation of the agent

email.description: The email ID of the agent

roles.description: Special role privileges. See below for values (deprecated)

role_id.description: The role ID of the agent

enabled.description: Describes whether the agent is enabled

name.description: The name to be displayed for the visitor

created.description: The create date for the visitor

email.description: The email ID of the visitor

banned.description: Whether the visitor is currently banner or not

notes.description: Any additional notes about the visitor

phone.description: The phone number of the visitor (if available)

type.description: Chat type. One of offline_msg, chat

started_by.description: Who started the chat. Can be one of visitor, agent or trigger

session.description: Information related to the session of the session of the chat

count.description: Number of messages (each) by the visitor and the agent(s)

department_id.description: The ID of the department to which the chat is directed

department_name.description: The name of the department to which the chat is directed

response_time.description: Statistics about the response times in the chat, avg, max and first

agent_names.description: Names of agents involved in the chat

agent_ids.description: IDs of agents involved in the chat

triggered.description: Whether the chat was a triggered chat or not

triggered_response.description: Whether the response was a triggered response or not

missed.description: Whether the chat was missed or not

history.description: Chronological list of messages in the chat

conversions.description: Last 20 conversions (if any) attributed to the chat

rating.description: The customer satisfaction rating for the chat

comment.description: The customer comment on the chat

webpath.description: The list of pages the customer navigated to during the chat

zendesk_ticket_id.description: The ID of the Zendesk Support ticket created from this chat. Available only if using version 2 of the Zendesk Chat-Support integration

scope.description: Scope of the shortcut applicability. Allowed values: all, agent, department

agents.description: Agent the shortcut belongs to if the scope is agent. Currently only first element is taken into consideration.

departments.description: Departments the shortcut belongs to if the scope is department

tags.description: List of tags that will be added to chat if the shortcut is used

enabled.description: Whether the trigger is enabled or not

visitor_id.description: The ID of the banned visitor

visitor_name.description: The display name of the banned visitor

ip_address.description: The IP address of the banned visitor

enabled.description: Describes whether the department is enabled

members.description: The member agent IDs for the account

enabled.description: Describes whether the goal is enabled

attribution_model.description: Describes the attribution model associated with the goal. One of first_touch, last_touch

attribution_period.description: Describes the attribution period in days for this goal. Range between 1 to 30

settings.description: The settings for the goal. Contains the conditions array (described below).

enabled.description: Describes whether the skill is enabled

members.description: The member agent IDs for the account

name.description: The name of the role. *The name cannot be changed for the Owner, Admin, and Agent roles. You can change it for custom roles

description.description: The description of the role. *The description cannot be changed for the Owner, Admin, and Agent roles. You can change it for custom roles

enabled.description: Describes whether the role is enabled. *Owner, Admin, and Agent roles cannot be disabled. You can disable custom roles

members_count.description: The number of members on this role

permissions.description: The permissions for the role (described below). *The permissions cannot be changed for Owner and Admin roles. You can change them for Agent and custom roles

next_page.comment: The URL that should be called to get the next set of results

end_time.comment: The most recent time present in this result set in Unix epoch time; this is used as the start_time in the next_page URL

end_id.comment: The most recent item's ID present in this result set; this is used as the start_id in the next_page URL

count.comment: The number of results returned for the current request

id.description: The ID of the client. Automatically assigned when created

client_secret.description: The client secret. Generated automatically when created and returned in full only at that time

client_type.description: Can be "public" (default) or "confidential". If you resave the client using the UI, reverts to "public"

redirect_uris.description: A list of the valid redirect URIs for this client

scopes.description: Allowed scopes for this client. Only supports read/write

agent_id.description: The ID of the agent who created the client

create_date.description: The time the client was created

update_date.description: The time of the last update of the client

id.description: The ID of the token. Automatically assigned when created

agent_id.description: The ID of the user this token authenticates as

client_identifier.description: The ID of the client this token belongs to

scopes.description: One or more allowed scopes for the client. Can be read, write, and chat. See OAuth Authentication

create_date.description: The time the token was created
